channel.title: Trying to move out
channel.description:
Ok, i am trying to move into my own place and am having issues with costs.
At the moment, my total bills per week are $100. this includes car costs, telephone bills and petrol.
i would estimate that that i would go thru absalutly no more than $100 on weekly lunch during work and an outing once a week.
so, far, that is $200 in expenses. Leaving me with $440 a week out of my wages.
Now, renting a place to live would be likely to cost me somewhere in the range of $200 to $300. Leaving me with around $150. Minus the cost of food, and ill be lucky to have $50 left.
Now i am lucky enough to have a job that pays more than minimum wage... but i cannot seem to scrape much money after i calculate all my bills... how the hell do people survive on such little money? I want to own my own house eventualy... but being able to save less than $100 a week... it would take me decades to even save up for the deposit...

item.title: Trying to move out
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

pk4pk:

Easy solution’s: GO TO COLLEGE, get a better job, join army

I don’t know about other countries, but Australia treats its defence force members pretty well. The only problem is that the army/airforce/navy isn’t for everyone.

Read full topic

item.title: Trying to move out
item.dc:creator: @Squigglyo Squigglyo
item.description:
@Squigglyo wrote:

pk4pk:

Easy solution’s: GO TO COLLEGE, get a better job, join army

  1. college doesnt mean you get a better job, it just means you spend 5+ years spending money to listen to someone talk.
  2. a better job… im at the peak of entry jobs. A better job than what i have would prolly need me to spend a year or so working in the same job to get promoted.
  3. I applied once… apparently i was ‘too qualified’ to be someone that shoots mindlessly at things… so i guess im stuck being a lover, not a fighter.

Read full topic

item.title: Trying to move out
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

I found an awesome job at ALDI that pays $20.40/hour.
Applied for it, so if I get that and work around 35 hours p/week I should get around $550 after tax.

Which is pretty good for being 16.

I just worked out… For working over christmas, Christmas eve, Day, Boxing day, Saturday and the sunday… A Max of 5 days or 29 hours… I would get payed £278 before tax … Tax is sooo depressin

item.title: Trying to move out
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

[quote=“Tico135, post:25, topic:250025”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=329647.msg2578180#msg2578180 date=1229100310]
Moving out on your own is tough. When I first moved out, I lived with 2 other people and at the end of the month, after all my expenses, was lucky to have a surplus of $10. You just have to do the best you can, welcome to life.
[/quote]

Then you start up a runescape cheating site and make thousands of dollars per month. Haha.[/quote]

That wasn’t funny at all. Haha.

item.title: Trying to move out
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

If your thinking long term, be careful because the Australian dollar is likely to drop sooner or later. If you’ve saved a lot, try and put it somewhere less risky than currency. Holding your money in currency isn’t the best idea right now, with the beautiful state of the economy. Perhaps buy gold.

Read full topic

item.title: Trying to move out
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

Cut back on the eating fatty.
Just buy groceries, and don’t go out once a week either. I spend roughly $200 a month on food.

item.title: Trying to move out
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“Taios, post:15, topic:250025”][quote author=PaulT link=topic=329647.msg2577361#msg2577361 date=1229037820]
There are tons of jobs like she described. Cleaning the bird shit out of cuckoo clocks, basically. Bourgeoisie corporate suck.
[/quote]

LOL…that wouldnt give me time to do homework and crap…

Because my job is perfect!
I sit around playing on the laptop, doing homework, watching sky sports tv and getting a full cooked breakfast for £1.
I can do all school work during my job and further more i will have absolute peace and quiet, no external interferences to fuck up my exams after I’ve worked very hard towards them.

What do you do? Whore yourself out on the interwebs?

I work as a hall porter…on the weekend its dead quiet and there’s nothing to do.
If people from the accommodation block come over, they may want a key or something which can be obtained without me getting up from my seat lol.
And when its lunch and breakfast i have to take money…but the till is right next to where i sit.
O and at 9oclock i have to go put newspapers in a room.

And when people work the night shift there IS FUCK ALL TO DO…so they bring in their ps3’s and xbox’s and play them lol[/quote]Your job is godly.

Read full topic

item.title: Trying to move out
item.dc:creator: @Taios Taios
item.description:
@Taios wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:10, topic:250025”][quote author=Taios link=topic=329647.msg2577224#msg2577224 date=1229034221]
:S
How im planning it -
£650 wages (i dont get taxed for im student)
£100pm on food
£300 - rent
£150 - car
£50 - Mobile. random other costs.
Im still left with £50 for w/e

I also get another £30 per week if im in school on time everyday…so that should cover going out and stuff.
[/quote]
How do you manage to juggle an okay paying job with college!? I can’t see a way to do that :(.

Also I get EMA too, £30 a week for turning up to lessons is awesome.[/quote]

Because my job is perfect!
I sit around playing on the laptop, doing homework, watching sky sports tv and getting a full cooked breakfast for £1.
I can do all school work during my job and further more i will have absolute peace and quiet, no external interferences to fuck up my exams after I’ve worked very hard towards them.

Read full topic
